description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in the first presidential debate:
quote_txt: Obama says he’s "put forward a specific $4 trillion deficit reduction plan."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in the first presidential debate in Denver:
quote_txt: "Right now, the (Congressional Budget Office) says up to 20 million people will lose their insurance as Obamacare goes into effect next year."

description_txt: stated on September 30, 2012 in an interview on NBC’s “Meet The Press”:
quote_txt: "(Barack Obama) says he’s going to reduce the long-term debt and deficit by $4 trillion, doesn’t say how he's going to do it."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2012 in a debate.:
quote_txt: Says Eric Cantor voted to assure Congress would be paid if the government shut down and against guaranteeing troops would be paid.

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2012 in a UNITY PAC press release.:
quote_txt: Says Austin voters can approve seven bond propositions "without raising taxes."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2012 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "While Mandel's been busy traveling the country raising campaign money, he hasn't shown up for work."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in the first presidential debate:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney's plan "calls for a $5 trillion tax cut."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: Says Barack Obama "put in place a board that can tell people ultimately what treatments they're going to receive."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in the first presidential debate in Denver:
quote_txt: "We’re now spending 42 percent of our economy on government."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in the first presidential debate:
quote_txt: Romney "would turn Medicare into a voucher program."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2012 in a presidential debate:
quote_txt: "On Medicare for current retirees, he's cutting $716 billion from the program."

name_txt: Promote Oregon Leadership PAC (Oregon House Republicans)
description_txt: stated on October 1, 2012 in campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Ben Unger supported a 15 percent property tax increase on Oregon seniors.

description_txt: stated on September 19, 2012 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says Adam Hasner said he will never accept a pay increase, but he voted to raise his pay four times.

description_txt: stated on September 25, 2012 in a campaign event in New Hampshire:
quote_txt: "The income tax that started at 2 percent under Governor Byrne is now 9 percent."

description_txt: stated on September 11, 2012 in an election flier :
quote_txt: Says Ohio's Issue 2 will create a redistricting commission that will "have a blank check to spend our money."

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2012 in a TV show appearance:
quote_txt: "One of the first states in the union to pass a voter ID bill was Rhode Island, 85 percent Democratic legislature."

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2012 in a TV show appearance:
quote_txt: Rhode Island’s voter identification law was pushed by "a black Democrat in the House, a black Democrat in the Senate. That's a fact."

description_txt: stated on September 30, 2012 in an interview on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "already passed all these Obamacare taxes. About a dozen of them hit middle-income taxpayers."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2012 in Atlanta City Council meeting:
quote_txt: Almost 400 arrests in the city last year for panhandling-related offenses involved just 78 suspects, an indication that the same people are panhandling over and over.

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2012 in a mailer to voters:
quote_txt: The Obama administration’s "green" stimulus program "funneled close to $2 billion dollars to overseas firms," creating thousands of jobs in China.

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Chinese tire imports threatened 1,000 American jobs, so President Obama "stood up to China and protected American workers. Mitt Romney attacked Obama's decision."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2012 in a mailer:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney’s investments created zero jobs.

description_txt: stated on September 19, 2012 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says the "public option" considered in the health care law backed by U.S. Senate candidate Tammy Baldwin was "wildly unpopular."

description_txt: stated on September 24, 2012 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Says Ronald Reagan "was behind in the polls in 1980 going into the debate with Jimmy Carter and then turned around 10 days later and won 40 states."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2012 in press release:
quote_txt: "In every state, women are paid less than men."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2012 in a news release.:
quote_txt: George Allen "voted to end Pell Grants for 84,000 students."

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2012 in a news conference:
quote_txt: "Since the time of the Civil War, we've made a distinction in this country between the availability and the ability to access for people who were in the military, versus the rest of us, to vote."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2012 in a campaign email:
quote_txt: Says 7,000 millionaires "gamed the system to pay no income taxes."

description_txt: stated on August 29, 2012 in an online news release:
quote_txt: "Bob Menendez actually voted in favor of higher taxes more than 70 times!"
